title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance

title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance

text: sources, was a principal figure at the Court of Henry IV., and,

text: I had afterwards such good reason to look back upon and remember the
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: events of that afternoon, that Catherine's voice seems to ring in my
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: brain even now.  I can shut my eyes and see again, after all these
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: years, what I saw then--just the blue summer sky, and one grey angle of
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the keep, from which a fleecy cloud was trailing like the smoke from a
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: chimney.  I could see no more because I was lying on my back, my head
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: resting on my hands. Marie and Croisette, my brothers, were lying by me
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: in exactly the same posture, and a few yards away on the terrace,
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Catherine was sitting on a stool Gil had brought out for her.  It was
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the second Thursday in August, and hot.  Even the jackdaws were silent.
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I had almost fallen asleep, watching my cloud grow longer and longer,
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and thinner and thinner, when Croisette, who cared for heat no more
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: than a lizard, spoke up sharply, "Mademoiselle," he said, "why are you
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: watching the Cahors road?"
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I had not noticed that she was doing so.  But something in the keenness
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of Croisette's tone, taken perhaps with the fact that Catherine did not
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: at once answer him, aroused me; and I turned to her.  And lo!  she was
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: blushing in the most heavenly way, and her eyes were full of tears, and
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: she looked at us adorably.  And we all three sat up on our elbows, like
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: three puppy dogs, and looked at her.  And there was a long silence.
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: And then she said quite simply to us, "Boys, I am going to be married
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to M. de Pavannes."
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I fell flat on my back and spread out my arms.  "Oh, Mademoiselle!" I
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: cried reproachfully.
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: "Oh, Mademoiselle!" cried Marie.  And he fell flat on his back, and
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: spread out his arms and moaned.  He was a good brother, was Marie, and
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: obedient.
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: And Croisette cried, "Oh, mademoiselle!"  too.  But he was always
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: ridiculous in his ways.  He fell flat on his back, and flopped his arms
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and squealed like a pig.
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Yet he was sharp.  It was he who first remembered our duty, and went to
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Catherine, cap in hand, where she sat half angry and half confused, and
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: said with a fine redness in his cheeks, "Mademoiselle de Caylus, our
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: cousin, we give you joy, and wish you long life; and are your servants,
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and the good friends and aiders of M. de Pavannes in all quarrels, as--"
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But I could not stand that.  "Not so fast, St. Croix de Caylus" I said,
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: pushing him aside--he was ever getting before me in those days--and
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: taking his place.  Then with my best bow I began, "Mademoiselle, we
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: give you joy and long life, and are your servants and the good friends
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and aiders of M. de Pavannes in all quarrels, as--as--"
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: "As becomes the cadets of your house," suggested Croisette, softly.
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: "As becomes the cadets of your house," I repeated.  And then Catherine
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: stood up and made me a low bow and we all kissed her hand in turn,
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: beginning with me and ending with Croisette, as was becoming.
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Afterwards Catherine threw her handkerchief over her face--she was
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: crying--and we three sat down, Turkish fashion, just where we were, and
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: said "Oh, Kit!"  very softly.
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But presently Croisette had something to add.  "What will the Wolf
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: say?"  he whispered to me.
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: "Ah!  To be sure!"  I exclaimed aloud.  I had been thinking of myself
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: before; but this opened quite another window.  "What will the Vidame
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: say, Kit?"
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance

author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: She dropped her kerchief from her face, and turned so pale that I was
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: sorry I had spoken--apart from the kick Croisette gave me. "Is M. de
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Bezers at his house?"  she asked anxiously.
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: "Yes," Croisette answered.  "He came in last night from St. Antonin,
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: with very small attendance."
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: The news seemed to set her fears at rest instead of augmenting them as
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I should have expected.  I suppose they were rather for Louis de
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Pavannes, than for herself.  Not unnaturally, too, for even the Wolf
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: could scarcely have found it in his heart to hurt our cousin.  Her
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: slight willowy figure, her pale oval face and gentle brown eyes, her
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: pleasant voice, her kindness, seemed to us boys and in those days, to
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: sum up all that was womanly.  We could not remember, not even Croisette
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the youngest of us--who was seventeen, a year junior to Marie and
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: myself--we were twins--the time when we had not been in love with her.
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But let me explain how we four, whose united ages scarce exceeded
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: seventy years, came to be lounging on the terrace in the holiday
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: stillness of that afternoon.  It was the summer of 1572.  The great
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: peace, it will be remembered, between the Catholics and the Huguenots
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: had not long been declared; the peace which in a day or two was to be
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: solemnized, and, as most Frenchmen hoped, to be cemented by the
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: marriage of Henry of Navarre with Margaret of Valois, the King's
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: sister.  The Vicomte de Caylus, Catherine's father and our guardian,
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: was one of the governors appointed to see the peace enforced; the
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: respect in which he was held by both parties--he was a Catholic, but no
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: bigot, God rest his soul!--recommending him for this employment.  He
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: had therefore gone a week or two before to Bayonne, his province.  Most
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of our neighbours in Quercy were likewise from home, having gone to
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Paris to be witnesses on one side or the other of the royal wedding.
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: And consequently we young people, not greatly checked by the presence
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of good-natured, sleepy Madame Claude, Catherine's duenna, were
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: disposed to make the most of our liberty; and to celebrate the peace in
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: our own fashion.
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: We were country-folk.  Not one of us had been to Pau, much less to
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Paris.  The Vicomte held stricter views than were common then, upon
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: young people's education; and though we had learned to ride and shoot,
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to use our swords and toss a hawk, and to read and write, we knew
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: little more than Catherine herself of the world; little more of the
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: pleasures and sins of court life, and not one-tenth as much as she did
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of its graces.  Still she had taught us to dance and make a bow.  Her
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: from the frank companionship of Louis de Pavannes, a Huguenot whom the
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Vicomte had taken prisoner at Moncontour and held to ransom.  We were
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: not, I think, mere clownish yokels.
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance

title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance

title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: panic, I confess!
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance

title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance

title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance

title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: failed to gain it, and drew himself up behind a buttress of the tower,
title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance

title: The House of the Wolf: A Romance
author: Weyman, Stanley John
